    • Field Detail

      • ADDRESS_DEFAULT

        public static final byte ADDRESS_DEFAULT

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoboClaw

        public RoboClaw(String aTTY)
         throws Exception
        The constructor creates a RoboClaw object based on the TTY that the RoboClaw is connected to. The Address for packet-serial protocol purposes is set to the default address of 0x80.
        Parameters:
        aTTY - The TTY on which to find the RoboClaw.
        Throws:
        Exception - An exception is thrown if the TTY device could not be found or opened.

      • RoboClaw

        public RoboClaw(String aTTY,
        byte aAddress)
         throws Exception
        The constructor creates a RoboClaw object based on the TTY that the RoboClaw is connected to as well as the address of the RoboClaw. For a RoboClaw in Packet Serial mode, the address must be configured on the RoboClaw. The default address is "0x80" and several RoboClaw devices may be chained on the same physical TTY line. For USB mode, the address defaults to "0x80" and only one RoboClaw will be found on each of the virtual TTY devices.
        Parameters:
        aTTY - The TTY on which to find the RoboClaw.
        aAddress - The address of the RoboClaw when in packet serial mode.
        Throws:
        Exception - This exception is thrown if the TTY device could not be found.
